title: About Me
text: I am a PhD student in Biostatistics at USC, working on distribution prediction models based on outcome ranks.

title: About Me
text:

title: Welcome to My Website
text:
My Projects
Here are some of my research experiences:

Penalized Cumulative Probability Models using Cyclical Coordinate Descent
Patterning Human Kidney Organoids with Synthetic Wnt-Secreting Organizers :)
Multilevel Modeling Analysis for Equine Cardiac Arrhythmias

title: My Projects
text:
Cardiac Arrhythmia in Equine Health: A Statistical Analysis of Electrocardiogram Data
We analyzed electrocardiogram recordings from 33 horses (37 total recordings) representing three arrhythmia types: Ventricular Premature Complexes (VPC), Atrial Premature Complexes (APC), and Sinus Arrhythmia (SA). We constructed heart rate interval variables from abnormal heartbeat patterns and conducted exploratory data analysis to assess inter-horse variability. After standardizing variables to control for between-horse differences, we performed ANOVA tests to compare arrhythmia types and applied multilevel modeling to examine the relationship between heart rate changes before and after premature beats. Finally, we utilized K-means and hierarchical clustering analyses to evaluate whether the arrhythmia classifications could be distinguished based on heart rate patterns.
